item.title: 萨默斯特朗普的政策 "每天都在改进
item.description: 欢迎收看《华尔街一周》时事通讯，我们将为您带来资本主义的故事，您需要知道的事情，但更需要思考的事情。我是大卫-威斯汀（David Westin），本周我们将聆听哈佛大学特约撰稿人拉里-萨默斯（Larry Summers）讲述唐纳德-特朗普总统领导下的美国经济的戏剧性故事，以及前交通部长伊莱恩-赵（Elaine Chao）讲述我们需要做些什么来修复美国空中交通管制系统。如果您还不是本新闻通讯的订阅者，请在此注册。【原文：Welcome to the Wall Street Week newsletter, bringing you stories of capitalism about things you need to know, but even more things you need to think about. I'm David Westin, and this week we heard from special contributor Larry Summers of Harvard on the dramatic story of the US economy under President Donald Trump and from former Transportation Secretary Elaine Chao on what we need to do to fix the US air traffic control system. If you're not yet a subscriber, sign up here for this newsletter.】

item.title: 据说 GTCR 接近达成以约 32 亿美元收购 OSTTRA 的交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，私募股权公司 GTCR 即将以约 32 亿美元的价格收购 OSTTRA，后者是一家在外汇和衍生品市场提供交易后服务的合资企业。【原文：Private equity firm GTCR is nearing a deal to buy OSTTRA, a venture that conducts post-trade services in the foreign exchange and derivatives markets, for about $3.2 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 意大利乔盖蒂表示，尽管经济增长放缓，但不会额外借贷
item.description: 意大利财政部长吉安卡洛-乔盖蒂（Giancarlo Giorgetti）表示，尽管经济增长预期较低，但意大利不需要额外借贷。【原文：Italy won’t require additional borrowing despite lower economic growth estimates, according to Finance Minister Giancarlo Giorgetti.】

item.title: 波兰财政部长认为增长预期面临小幅下行风险
item.description: 波兰财政部长安杰伊-多曼斯基（Andrzej Domanski）认为，与全球贸易紧张局势有关的 "小幅下行 "风险会影响波兰今年的经济增长。【原文：Poland’s Finance Minister Andrzej Domanski sees a “small downside” risk related to global trade tensions for the country’s economic growth this year.】

item.title: 贝森特对中国有一个 "大包围 "计划
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）在本周的市场动荡中脱颖而出，成为或许出人意料的首席贸易谈判代表，为未来数月提供了一种可能的情景：美国与长期合作伙伴达成协议，对中国施加压力。【原文：US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent emerged from this week’s market ructions as a perhaps-unexpected lead trade negotiator, offering a potential scenario for the coming months: US deals with longstanding partners that put pressure on China.】

item.title: 毛里求斯计划新增支出，国际货币基金组织（IMF）就下一期预算支出发出警告
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）敦促毛里求斯政府在下一份预算中减少支出，以稳定财政状况，在此背景下，毛里求斯的立法者将就截至 6 月的财政年度的 210 亿卢比（约合 4.72 亿美元）额外支出进行表决。【原文：Mauritius’ lawmakers will vote on additional spending of 21 billion rupees ($472 million) for the fiscal year through June, as the International Monetary Fund urges the government to reduce outlays in the next budget in order to stabilize its finances.】

item.title: 极端天气袭击中国，导致航班取消
item.description: 周六，强风和暴雨袭击中国，造成沙尘暴威胁，航班和火车被迫取消。【原文：Strong, damaging winds and heavy rains struck China on Saturday, leading to a threat of sandstorms and the cancellation of flights and trains.】

item.title: 特朗普计划下令囤积关键金属：金融时报
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》报道，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的政府正计划颁布一项行政命令，允许从太平洋海底储存关键金属。【原文：US President Donald Trump’s administration is planning an executive order to allow the stockpiling of critical metals from the Pacific seabed, according to the Financial Times.】

item.title: 挪威财富基金计划支持帕斯基的 Mediobanca 收购案
item.description: 挪威主权财富基金持有锡耶纳蒙蒂帕斯基银行（Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena SpA）超过2.5%的股份，该基金计划在下周举行的一次重要投资者会议上支持这家意大利银行竞购竞争对手Mediobanca SpA。【原文：Norway’s sovereign wealth fund, which owns a stake of more than 2.5% in Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena SpA, plans to back the Italian bank’s bid for competitor Mediobanca SpA at a crucial investor meeting next week.】

item.title: 亚洲各地的 "醉拳 "交易员准备好迎接又一周的 "闹剧 "了
item.description: 在经历了亚洲股市创下有史以来最大暴跌和自 2008 年以来最大单日涨幅的一周之后，该地区的投资者们周末加班、不睡觉、中断出差、关注社交媒体并专注于短期交易，警惕着地球上离他们最远的一个人随时可能再次颠覆市场。【原文：After a week in which Asian stocks posted both their biggest-ever plunge and their largest one-day gain since 2008, investors in the region are working weekends, skipping sleep, interrupting business trips, poring over social media and focusing on short-term trades, alert to the fact that one man at the furthest point away from them on the planet can upend markets again at any moment.】

item.title: 全球经济图表：关税暂停带来的动荡
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在本周中决定暂停美国最严厉的关税措施（对中国的超高关税除外），此后几天，全球金融市场依然动荡不安，投资者纷纷寻求避风港，一些国家的央行也降低了利率。【原文：In the days following President Donald Trump’s mid-week decision to pause the stiffest of US tariffs — save for super-high duties on China — global financial markets remained turbulent, with investors seeking safe harbor and some central banks lowering interest rates.】

item.title: 西班牙称欧盟应利用冻结的俄罗斯资产加强国防建设
item.description: 西班牙提议设立一个新的国防基金，提供不可退还的赠款，以加强欧洲的防线，并利用俄罗斯无法动用的中央银行资产为乌克兰提供支持。【原文：Spain proposed setting up a new defense fund to provide non-refundable grants to beef up Europe’s defense lines and provide support for Ukraine using Russia’s immobilized central bank assets.】

item.title: 英国央行格林称美元走势使关税政策应对复杂化
item.description: 英国央行决策者梅根-格林（Megan Greene）表示，美国关税将减缓经济增长，但对通胀的影响并不明显，因为美元的表现不尽如人意。【原文：Bank of England policymaker Megan Greene said US tariffs will slow growth but the impact on inflation was less clear because the dollar is not behaving as would be expected.】

item.title: 吉姆-查诺斯谈关税、人工智能、私募股权和埃隆-马斯克
item.description: 吉姆-查诺斯谈关税、人工智能、私募股权和埃隆-马斯克【原文：Jim Chanos on Tariffs, AI, Private Equity, and Elon Musk】

item.title: 大风和沙尘暴迫使北京取消数百航班
item.description: 北京（美联社）— 周六，大风和沙尘暴的威胁促使北京取消了数百个航班并关闭了公共公园，大风吹倒了数百棵树，压坏了汽车，损坏了中国首都的老房子。【原文：BEIJING (AP) — High winds and the threat of sandstorms Saturday prompted Beijing to cancel hundreds of flights and close public parks, as massive gales felled hundreds of trees, crushing cars and damaging older homes across China’s capital.】

item.title: 范思哲交易强化了亿万富翁普拉达家族的继承计划
item.description: 数十年来，独立自主的 Prada SpA 董事长 Patrizio Bertelli 一直在谈论意大利时装公司需要扩大规模，以对抗 LVMH 和 Kering SA 等庞大的行业巨头，同时避免被它们吞并。【原文：For decades, the fiercely independent Prada SpA Chairman Patrizio Bertelli talked about the need for Italian fashion houses to acquire size and scale to take on sprawling industry behemoths like LVMH and Kering SA and also avoid being gobbled up by them.】

item.title: 欧洲企业囤积货物、转移生产以应对关税
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）暂时放弃了最大幅度的关税增长。但由于其他关税依然存在，欧盟企业在美国开展业务的成本将会更高。【原文：Donald Trump has — for now — backed off of his steepest tariff increases. But with other duties still in place, doing business in the US is about to get costlier for EU companies.】

item.title: 特朗普在暂停关税前数小时向瑞士承诺
item.description: 就在唐纳德-特朗普暂停对全球征收大部分关税的数小时前，他向瑞士总统承诺将重新考虑对瑞士的征税问题。【原文：Donald Trump promised his Swiss counterpart to look again at levies inflicted on her country just hours before he suspended much of his tariff onslaught on the world.】

item.title: 中国部长称美国关税可能引发人道主义危机
item.description: 中国贸易部长王文涛表示，美国不断加征关税将对发展中国家造成巨大伤害，甚至可能引发人道主义危机。【原文：Chinese Trade Minister Wang Wentao said the continuous introduction of tariffs by the US will cause great harm to the developing world and may even trigger a humanitarian crisis.】

item.title: 德国希望成为军事强国。它能成功吗？
item.description: 新任总理弗里德里希-梅尔茨（Friedrich Merz）本周达成了一项联盟协议，为无限制的国防开支打开了大门。现在，他面临着一项更为艰巨的任务：在没有美国支持的情况下，将德国打造成足以威慑弗拉基米尔-普京的军事强国。【原文：Newly minted Chancellor Friedrich Merz secured a coalition deal this week that opens the door to unlimited defense spending. Now, he faces a far harder task: turning Germany into a military power strong enough to deter Vladimir Putin without US support.】

item.title: 特朗普的利兹-特鲁斯时刻帮助英国牢记债券市场是老大
item.description: 当美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布暂停对全球市场造成严重破坏的关税冲击时，英国首相基尔-斯塔默的助手们想起了一位前任首相的命运。【原文：When US President Donald Trump announced he was pausing his onslaught of tariffs that had wreaked havoc on global markets, UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s aides were reminded of the fate of a near predecessor.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》称 Binance 上月与财政部官员会面
item.description: 华尔街日报》援引熟悉会谈情况的未具名人士的话报道称，Binance 高管今年 3 月与财政部官员会面，讨论美国放松对其监管的问题。【原文：Binance executives met with officials from the Treasury Department in March to discuss a loosening of US oversight on it, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing unidentified people familiar with the talks.】

item.title: 泰尔支持的风险投资公司完成 46 亿美元的 Founders 基金 III
item.description: 根据美国证券交易委员会周五提交的一份文件，彼得-蒂尔支持的创始人基金（Founders Fund）已完成了一项46亿美元的后期风险投资基金。【原文：The Peter Thiel-backed Founders Fund has closed a $4.6 billion later-stage venture capital fund, according to a US Securities and Exchange Commission filing Friday.】

item.title: 特朗普提出 10%基准关税的可能例外情况
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，他可以对大多数美国贸易伙伴征收的10%关税提供一些豁免；尽管他坚称，对于寻求谈判贸易协议的国家来说，这已经 "非常接近 "底线。【原文：President Donald Trump said he could offer some exemptions to his 10% tariff on most US trading partners — even as he insisted that it was “pretty close” to a floor for nations seeking to negotiate trade deals.】

item.title: BayPine 达成收购临床试验公司 CenExel 的协议
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，投资公司 BayPine 已同意以约 15 亿美元的价格收购 CenExel 临床研究公司。【原文：The investment firm BayPine has agreed to acquire CenExel Clinical Research for about $1.5 billion, according to people familiar with the matter, in a sign companies are still striking deals even as uncertainty roils financial markets.】

item.title: Netflix 测试新的人工智能搜索引擎以推荐节目和电影
item.description: Netflix 公司正在为用户测试新的搜索技术，该技术利用人工智能帮助用户查找电视节目和电影，扩大了该技术的使用范围。【原文：Netflix Inc. is testing new search technology for subscribers that employs artificial intelligence to help them find TV shows and movies, expanding its use of the technology.】

item.title: Golub 在市场动荡期间加速为新的 CLO 购买贷款
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Golub Capital 本周迅速购买了大量杠杆贷款，以利用价格大幅下跌的机会。【原文：Golub Capital quickly bought a large amount of leveraged loans this week to take advantage of prices dropping significantly, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 前谷歌首席执行官称加拿大可满足人工智能竞赛的能源需求
item.description: 谷歌前首席执行官埃里克-施密特（Eric Schmidt）表示，如果加拿大能够在与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的贸易战中与美国合作，那么加拿大丰富的水电资源将为蓬勃发展的人工智能服务器提供最佳动力，并在全球人工智能竞赛中获胜。【原文：Canada’s abundant hydroelectricity offers the best way to power booming artificial intelligence servers and win the global AI race — if the country is able to cooperate with the US amid a trade war with President Donald Trump, according to former Google chief Eric Schmidt.】

item.title: Meta 将特朗普前顾问、Stripe 首席执行官纳入董事会
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc.董事会增加了两名新成员：唐纳德-特朗普总统的重要前顾问迪娜-鲍威尔-麦考密克（Dina Powell McCormick）和金融技术公司 Stripe 的首席执行官帕特里克-科里森（Patrick Collison）。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. has added two new people to its board of directors — Dina Powell McCormick, a key former adviser to President Donald Trump, and Patrick Collison, the chief executive officer of Stripe, a financial technology company.】
